nexttext: and $r(s,\cos\theta)=\sqrt{s^2+R^2-2sR\cos{\theta}}$, being $R\simeq8.5\ \rm{kpc}$ the Sun-Galactic Center distance, $\Omega_{\rm DM}=0.2685$ and $\rho_c=5.5\times10^{-6}\ \rm{GeV cm}^{-3}$ \cite{Ade:2015xua}. It is worth observing that the DM distributions depend on the angular distance $\theta$ from the Galactic Center only, where $\cos\theta \equiv \cos b \cos l$, being $(b,l)$ the Galactic coordinates system. In our analysis, we consider two different DM galactic halo profiles \cite{Cirelli:2010xx}: the Navarro-Frenk-White distribution
